properties.areaDesc: South Central Oregon Cascades; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 3:30AM PST until January 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...Moderate Snow Expected Above 5000 feet in the Southern Oregon
Cascades, including Crater and Diamond Lake...

.A front is bringing light to moderate snow to the Cascades
tonight. Snow levels are around 5500 feet and will fall to around
4500 feet by Tuesday afternoon. Light snow showers will continue
Tuesday evening.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9
inches. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades above 5000 feet. This
includes portions of Highway 62, Highway 232, and near the
junction of Highways 138 and 230. It also includes Crater Lake
and Diamond Lake.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Tuesday. Snow will become lighter after
10 AM.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.

* Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and
limited visibilities.

* See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions.

* A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow
will cause travel difficulties.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
